title: 96: Digital Fascism
description:
We play a very dangerous game with technology, and the relationship that we have with it is very complicated and layered. The ability to broadcast a video or audio message from the comfort of oneâ€™s home to the rest of the world is best described as a form of magic.

But are we walking into a trap where the technology that we own comes to own us instead? Who really financed and built the technology that we depend on to get through our increasingly digital lives, and is the government using this to spy on everyone?

There is no longer a debate whether or not the government and Big Tech are spying on the public; the real debate is how much deeper will things go, and how much longer will the public tolerate it?
